thread.title: Rams to battle Hawks for District 1 title
thread.title_full: Rams to battle Hawks for District 1 title

author: desmoinesregister.com
title: Rams to battle Hawks for District 1 title
text:
Buy Photo Southeast Polk high school Rams (Photo: The Register) Buy Photo
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE The Rams collected their fifth consecutive win of the season when they defeated Sioux City North 45-7 at Sioux City Friday. The victory set up a show-down for the District 1 championship between the 5-3 Rams and 7-1 Ankeny Hawks who are both 4-0 in district play.
The Rams scored all 45 of their points in the first half when they scored a pair of touchdowns in the first quarter and rolled up 31 points in the second period. The North Stars scored their seven points in the third quarter on a 1-yard plunge.
Senior running back Cole Hauser led the Ram 301-yard rushing attack, gaining 127 yards on six carries for three touchdowns, including a 63-yard TD run. Junior Joe Ginther gained 57 yards on eight trips.
Senior quarterback Thomas McLaughlin had an outstanding night, passing 15 times for a total of 178 yards and three touchdowns, the longest being a 48-yard completion to Hauser. Gulick, Hauser and senior Austin Sutten had touchdown catches. McLaughlin's 15 completions were made to a total of six different Ram receivers.
Sophomore kicker Luke Williams collected nine points on six PAT kicks and a field goal.
The Division I championship will be decided Friday when the Rams host the Ankeny Hawks in Ram Stadium
 //dmreg.co/1RSFkDV
